question: Mixed up in that beating on Twelfth Street?
answer: No. Plain drunkenness.

question: This says he was picked up there.
answer: They had him on the carpet for an hour at Headquarters. He's clear. Plain drunkenness.

question: Where's your mamma, honey? Judy--we're ready for you now.
answer: He hates me.

question: What?
answer: He hates me.

question: What makes you think he hates you, Judy?
answer: I don't think. I know. He looks at me like I'm the ugliest thing in the world. He doesn't like my friends--he-- He doesn't like anything about me-- he calls me--he calls me--

question: He makes you feel pretty unhappy?
answer: He calls me a dirty tramp--my own father!

question: Do you think your father means that?
answer: Yes! I don't know! I mean maybe he doesn't mean it but he acts like he does. We're altogether and we're going to celebrate Easter and catch a double bill. Big deal. So I put on my new dress and I came out and he--

question: That one?
answer: Yes--he started yelling for a handkerchief--screaming. He grabbed my face and he rubbed all my lipstick off--he rubbed till I thought I wouldn't have any lips left. And all the time yelling at me--that thing--the thing I told you he called me. Then I ran out of the house.

question: Is that why you were wandering around at one o'clock in the morning?
answer: I was just talking a walk. I tried to call the kids but everybody was out and I couldn't find them. I hate my life. I just hate it.

question: You weren't looking for company, were you?
answer: No.

question: Did you stop to talk to anyone, Judy? Do you enjoy that?
answer: No. I don't even know why I do it.

question: Do you think you can get back at your Dad that way? I mean sometimes if we can't get as close to somebody as we'd like we have to try making them jealous--so they'll have to pay attention. Did you ever think of that?
answer: I'll never get close to anybody.

question: Some kids stomped a man on Twelfth Street, Judy.
answer: You know where they picked me up! Twelfth Street! I wasn't even near there!

question: Would you like to go home if we can arrange it? Did you notify the parents? What's your number, Judy? We'll see if your Dad will come and get you. Unless you really don't want to go home. Would you rather stay here?
answer: Lexington 05549.

question: Your mother will be down in a few minutes, Judy--
answer: What?

question: Your mother will be down in a few minutes.
answer: My mother?

question: She's being called for.
answer: You said you'd call my father.

question: Nobody can help me.
answer: Can you tell me why you killed the puppies, Plato?

question: No, sir. I just went next door to look at them like I always do. They were nursing on their mother and I did it. I guess I'm just no good?
answer: What do you think's going to happen, you do things like that?

question: I don't know. End up in the electric chair?
answer: Where did you get the gun?

question: I don't see what's so bad about taking a little drink.
answer: You don't?

question: No. I definitely don't. I did the sa--
answer: He's a minor, Mr. Stark, and it looks to me like he had more than a little drink.

question: Say, listen--
answer: Jim--don't hum.

question: I guess I cut pretty loose in my day too.
answer: Really, Frank? When was that?

question: Let me just explain to you--we just moved here, y'understand? The kid has no friends yet and--
answer: Tell him why we moved here.

question: Hold it, Jim.
answer: You can't protect me.

question: You mind if I try? You have to slam the door in my face? I try to get to him--what happens? Don't I give you everything you want? A bicycle--you get a bicycle. A car--
answer: You buy me many things. Thank you.

question: Someone should put poison in her epsom salts.
answer: Grandma?

question: Get lost.
answer: Hang loose, boy. I'm warning you.

question: Wash up and go home.
answer: Big tough character. You don't kid me, pal. How come you're not wearing your boots? Too bad you didn't connect. You could have gone to Juvenile Hall. That's what you want, isn't it?

question: No.
answer: Sure it is. You want to bug us till we have to lock you up. Why?

question: Leave me alone.
answer: No.

question: I don't know why--!
answer: Go on--don't give me that. Someone giving you hard looks?

question: I just get so-- Boy, sometimes the temperature goes way up.
answer: Okay. Okay. Let it out. You feel like you want to blow your wheels right now?

question: All the time! I don't know what gets into me--but I keep looking for trouble and I always--I swear you better lock me up. I'm going to smash somebody--I know it.
answer: Try the desk. That why you moved from the last town? 'Cause you were in trouble? You can talk about it if you want to--I know about it anyway. Routine check.

question: And they think they are protecting my by moving.
answer: You were getting a good start in the wrong direction back there. Why did you do it?

question: Mess that kid up? He called me chicken.
answer: And your folks didn't understand?

question: They never do.
answer: So then you moved?

question: They think I'll make friends if we move. Just move and everything'll be roses and sunshine.
answer: But you don't think that's a solution. Things pretty tough for you at home?

question: She eats him alive and he takes it. What a zoo!
answer: What?

question: A zoo. He always wants to be my pal, you know? But how can I give him anything when he's--I mean I love him and I don't want to hurt him--but I don't know what to do anymore except maybe die.
answer: Pretty mixed up?

question: If he could--
answer: "If he could" what? You mean your father?

question: I mean if he had the guts to knock Mom cold once I bet she'd be happy and I bet she'd stop picking. They make mush out of him. Just mush. One thing I know is I never want to be like him.
answer: Chicken?

question: I bet you see right through me, don't you? How can anyone grow up in this circus?
answer: You got me, Jim--but they do. Want some water?

question: Boy--if I had one day when I didn't have to be all confused and ashamed of everything--or I felt I belonged some place.
answer: Here. Look, will you do something for me? If the pot starts boiling again, will you come and see me before you get yourself in a jam? Even if you just want to talk--come in and shoot the breeze. It's easier sometimes than talking to your folks.

question: Okay--
answer: Any time--day or night. You calmed down enough to go back now?

question: Luck, Jim. Don't forget.
answer: Have some cigars.

question: No thanks, I don't smoke.
answer: Go on--Give 'em to your friends.

question: Come out of the alley, Beau! This is the last time I'm going to call you. Beau! All right--go to school alone!
answer: Hey! Hey, didn't I see you before some place? Hi. I saw you before.

question: Bully for you.
answer: You don't have to be unfriendly.

question: Now that's true!
answer: See?

question: "Life is crushing in on me."
answer: "Life can be beautiful." Hey, I know where it was.

question: Where what was.
answer: Where I saw you. Everything going okay now? You live around here?

question: Who lives?
answer: See, I'm new.

question: Won't mother be proud.
answer: You're really flipped--aren't you. Where's Dawson High School?

question: You going there?
answer: Yeah--why--

question: Dig the square wardrobe!
answer: Yeah. So where's the high school?

question: University and 10th--Want to carry my books?
answer: I was just getting my car. I could take you.

question: The kids take me.
answer: Oh.

question: I'll bet you're a real yo yo.
answer: A what?

question: Goodbye! See you!
answer: I'm not so bad.

question: Stella-a-a-a!
answer: Steady Marlon!

question: Wanna make the colored lights go around and around? What's that?
answer: A new disease.

question: Friend of yours?
answer: I'm glad they let you out.

question: Nobody chickened.
answer: I heard about it. You're lucky he lived.

question: Hi--can you tell we where I go? I'm just starting here. Thanks a lot.
answer: Hi. Hi.

question: Hi there.
answer: You remember me?

question: No. I don't think so--
answer: I'm sorry--I made a mistake.

question: Nothing. What's your name!
answer: Jim. What's yours?

question: Plato. It's a nickname. Listen, I told you not to fool with them. Now they're waiting for you.
answer: I know. That's why I came back.

question: You scared?
answer: I just don't want trouble.

question: He has a knife.
answer: I saw it. Gee, look at that thing swing, will you? Do you think it never stops?

question: No. It's perpetual motion.
answer: Oh, I bet some little guy comes in here at night and pushes it. Go- go-go!

question: Jim?
answer: I'm here.

question: They're still there! Jim--Do you think when the end of the world comes it'll be at night?
answer: No. In the morning. I just have a feeling.

question: If you don't want trouble, I know a place we can go-- It's a big mansion and we could sneak around there and they wouldn't even know. You could be safe-- There it is. Should we go?
answer: The shadows are getting long. You know something?

question: The shadows are getting long. You know something?
answer: What?

question: You watch too much television.
answer: Hey, he's real abstract and different.

question: I'm cute, too. Meaning me?
answer: What?

question: Chicken? You shouldn't call me that. You always at ringside? You always travel in this rank company? I thought only punks fought with knives.
answer: Who's fighting? This is the test, man. It's a crazy game.

question: I scratched my mosquito bites. I'm fine. I'm fine--thanks!
answer: Are you really going to meet them?

question: Who knows. Plato?
answer: What?

question: What's a chickie-run? Mom?
answer: Hiya, Jimbo. You thought I was Mom?

question: Yeah!
answer: It's just this get-up. The girl's out and I was bringing Mom's supper.

question: And you dropped it?
answer: Yeah! Shh!

question: That's funny!
answer: I better clean this up before she sees it.

question: Judy. What are you wishing for, Judy?
answer: I wasn't wishing. I was looking at the moon.

question: "Man in the Moon, how came you there-- Up in the sky where you are shining-- Floating so high in the frosty air--? Oh, say--Man in the Moon!"--
answer: How did you know that?

question: We used to sing it in school. Don't look at me with such horror. They had schools in those days.
answer: But the same song. I think it's fantastic!

question: We were romantic then too--
answer: Are you and Mom home tonight?

question: No. Why?
answer: Nothing, only it'd be nice to spend an evening together for a change.

question: With us old creeps? Come on, we have to eat.
answer: Daddy-- Good evening.

question: Hi.
answer: Didn't you forget something?

question: What? What's the matter with you? You're too old for that kind of stuff, kiddo. I thought you stopped doing that long ago.
answer: I didn't want to stop.

question: Nothing.
answer: I was talking to Dad.

question: I didn't kiss her so it's a big thing.
answer: I guess I just don't understand anything.

question: I'm tired, Judy. I'd like to change the subject.
answer: Why?

question: I'd like to, that's all. Girls your age don't do that. You need an explanation?
answer: Girls don't love their father? Since when? Since I got to be sixteen?

question: You awake?
answer: Yes.

question: Listen--I took a steak out of the freezer. I thought we could have a real old-fashioned stag party--just the two of us, what do you say?
answer: I'm not hungry. Hey--I want to ask you something.

question: Shoot, Jimbo.
answer: Suppose you knew that you had to do something very dangerous--where you have to prove something you need to know--a question of honor. Would you do it?

question: Is there some kind of trick answer?
answer: What would you do, Dad?

question: I wouldn't do anything hasty. Let's get a little light on the subject.
answer: Blood.

question: How'd that happen! What kind of trouble you in?
answer: The kind we've been talking about. Can you answer me now?

question: Listen--nobody should make a snap decision--This isn't something you just--we ought to consider all the pros and cons--
answer: We don't have time.

question: We'll make time. Where's some paper. We'll make a list and if we're still stuck then we ought to get some advice--
answer: What can you do when you have to be a man?

question: Well, now--
answer: Just give me a direct answer! You going to stop me from going, Dad?

question: You know I never stop you from anything. Believe me--you're at a wonderful age. In ten years you'll look back on this and wish you were a kid again.
answer: Ten years? Now, Dad--I need an answer now!

question: How'd you get here?
answer: I hitched.

question: Boy, I bet you'd go to a hanging.
answer: My personality's showing again. Should I leave?

question: No. It's okay.
answer: Come on. Let's see what we're driving. Just him.

question: Stay there.
answer: What you say your name was?

question: Jim Stark.
answer: Buzz Gundersen.

question: Hi.
answer: Glad to meet you.

question: Glad to meet you.
answer: Got some goodies for you, Buzzie-boy.

question: Flashlight? Looks good.
answer: Clean as a whistle. They both got plenty breeze.

question: Is he your friend?
answer: Yes. My best friend.

question: What's he like?
answer: Oh, I don't know. You have to get to know him. He doesn't say much but when he does you know he means it. He's sincere.

question: Well, that's the main thing--don't you think so?
answer: Maybe next summer he's going to take me hunting with him--and fishing. I want him to teach me how and I bet he won't get mad if I goof. His name's Jim. It's really James but he likes Jim more. People he really likes--he lets call him "Jamie."

question: Want to finish my hamburger? I only took a bite.
answer: Okay.

question: Better try the doors. Jump out. No--quick, man! You got to break quick. This is the edge, boy. This is the end.
answer: Yeah.

question: I like you, you know?
answer: Buzz? What are we doing this for?

question: Judy. Will you be okay? I got to go in. You better get home too. Hey--what?
answer: Why don't you come home with me? I mean nobody's home at my house--and I'm not tired, are you? I don't have many--people I can talk to.

question: Who has?
answer: If you want to come we could talk and then in the morning we could have breakfast like my dad used to-- Gee...if you could only have been my father...we could...

question: Hey...you flipped--or something? You better take off...
answer: O.K. G'night. I got to pick up my scooter. See you tomorrow.

question: I have to talk to someone, Mom. I have to talk to you both. And Dad this time you got to give me an answer.
answer: Go ahead.

question: I'm in terrible trouble.--You know that big high bluff near Miller- town Junction?
answer: Sure--there was a bad accident there. They showed the pictures on

question: I was in it.
answer: How!

question: It doesn't matter how. I was driving a stolen car--
answer: Do you enjoy doing this to me or what--

question: Mom--I'm not--
answer: And you wanted him to make a list!

question: I can't keep it to myself anymore--
answer: Well, just get it off your chest, son.

question: That's not what I mean. I've never done anything right. I've been going around with my head in a sling for years...I don't want to drag you into this but I can't help it. I don't think I can prove anything by going around pretending I'm tough any more, so maybe you look like one thing but you still feel like another.
answer: You're absolutely right!

question: Are you listening to me? You're involved in this! I want to go to the police and tell them I was mixed up in this thing tonight?
answer: You what?

question: Why should you be the only one.
answer: Look Jim. Far be it from me to tell you what to do, but there's--

question: Are you going to preach now? Are we going to have a sermon?
answer: I'm just explaining what you mean! You can't be an idealist all your life! Nobody thanks you for sticking your neck out!

question: I don't want to learn that!
answer: Well, it doesn't matter anyhow-- because we're moving.

question: No! You're not tearing me loose any more.
answer: Do I have to spell it out?

question: Let go of me--
answer: This place appeal to you or something? What's he going to pull--

question: Nothing, Crunch. They picked him up like the rest of--
answer: You see any cops?

question: Yeah. Yeah.
answer: You see any cops?

question: No--
answer: He's going to cheese, I tell you. Nobody arrested him!

question: I think I should go home.
answer: No. We're going to bring him down.

question: Crunch--my father's--You going to kill him?
answer: You clean out of your head? Come on!

question: Listen--
answer: He's not here. He's not at Juvenile Hall. I don't know where he is. He's out on a call and he'll be out all night. How old are you?

question: My parents know I'm out. They know I'm here.
answer: Come back tomorrow.

question: I'll wait for him.
answer: Why don't you come back tomorrow, son? Ever been booked before?

question: They'll be looking for you.
answer: They saw where I jumped! I didn't chicken! What do I have to do-- kill myself?

question: It doesn't matter to them.
answer: You were looking for me, weren't you?

question: No--I was just--maybe--
answer: I tried to call you before.

question: I thought so.
answer: Want some milk? That's all I can do when I'm nervous. Drink milk. Here--have a slug. You still pretty upset?

question: I'm numb.
answer: You cold?

question: Even if I'm near a fire, I'm cold. I guess just about everybody's cold.
answer: I swear, sometimes, you just want to hold onto somebody! Judy, what am I going to do? I can't go home again.

question: Neither can I.
answer: No? Why not? You know something? Sometimes I figure I'll never live to see my next birthday. Isn't that dumb?

question: No.
answer: Every day I look in the mirror and say, "What? You still here?" Man! Hey! You smiled! Like even today. I woke up this morning, you know? And the sun was shining and everything was nice. Then the first thing that happens is I see you and I thought this is going to be one terrific day so you better live it up, boy, 'cause tomorrow maybe you'll be nothing.

question: I'm sorry I treated you mean today. You shouldn't believe what I say when I'm with the kids. Nobody acts sincere.
answer: Why'd you get mixed up with them? You don't have to prove anything.

question: If you knew me you wouldn't say that.
answer: I don't think you trust anybody, do you?

question: Why?
answer: I'm getting that way, too.

question: Have you ever gone with anyone who--
answer: Sure. Lots of times.

question: So have I. But I've never been in love. Isn't that awful?
answer: Awful? No. It's just lonely. It's the loneliest time.

question: Why did you do that?
answer: I felt like it.

question: Your lips are soft when you kiss.
answer: Where you going?

question: I don't know, but we can't stay here.
answer: Where can we go? I can't go back into that zoo.

question: I'm never going back.
answer: Listen! I know a place! PLATO showed me before. An old deserted mansion near the planetarium Would you go with me? You can trust me, Judy.

question: Frank? I'm frightened.
answer: What's that pounding?

question: I don't know. First I thought it was Jim but--
answer: He's home. I heard the car.

question: Are you going down there?
answer: Look--just relax, will you? See? It stopped.

question: I still think you should go down.
answer: Who's there? Anyone there?

question: Open it.
answer: Who's out there? What? Look in his room! Jim! Jim! Son?

question: What are you doing?
answer: Where's Jim?

question: I don't know. Do you--do you know where he is?
answer: No. No, I don't. I know where-- Hope I didn't bother you. Goodnight.

question: Hey, come back here. Who are you?
answer: Jim!

question: Jim!
answer: Who's that!

question: It's me!
answer: How'd you find me? What's happening?

question: They're looking for you!--
answer: Yeah?

question: Everybody! Crunch and Goon and everybody! I think they're going to kill you.
answer: We know.

question: They think you told the police on them. They--who's in there?
answer: Judy.

question: Help me in!
answer: Hey where'd you go?

question: I'm here. Shut up.
answer: Come out come out wherever you are!

question: Shut up. Are you nuts?
answer: No. I'm scared.

question: We're safe here. I hope. What do you think?
answer: Wow! Well now-there-then!

question: Isn't it crazy?
answer: Wowee ow wow! Let's take it for the summer.

question: Oh, we can manage that! I'll scrimp and save and work my fingers to the bone...
answer: Why don't we just rent it for the season?

question: You see, we've just--oh, you tell him, darling. I'm so embarrassed I could die!
answer: Well--we're newlyweds.

question: Nobody talks to children! They just tell them one thing and mean another.
answer: It's wonderful that you understand so well--and so young too! You know the most wonderful feature about the nursery?

question: What?
answer: There's only one key.

question: We'll take it!
answer: Come on!

question: What time is it?
answer: Hang loose. We got all night.

question: That maid saw us. She could identify us too.
answer: You still want to go home, Moose?

question: No.
answer: Then shut your mouth before your guts run out!

question: I bet you hear everything I say!
answer: Isn't he schizoid?

question: Hey! How 'bout that!
answer: Haven't you noticed your personality splitting?

question: Not lately. How do you know so much about this junk, Plato?
answer: I had to go to a head-shrinker. I only went twice though. My mother said it cost too much, so she went to Hawaii instead.

question: No. Seriously. What's your trouble?
answer: I don't know but whatever it is, it's gone now. I mean I'm happy now. Here. I came here before.

question: When was that?
answer: When I was here? When I ran away. I used to run away a lot but they always took me back.

question: Who?
answer: Mom and Dad. I used to be in my crib and I'd listen to them fight.

question: It's all right.
answer: Sure. You have a long life-line.

question: So have you.
answer: Ever been in a place like this before?

question: Not exactly. It's certainly huge.
answer: How many rooms do you think there are?

question: I don't know.
answer: Should we explore? Hey! Will you look at this room! Judy? Want to read any books? Take your pick! Isn't this the craziest?

question: Hi.
answer: Hi. What?

question: Your hand's all wet and it's shaky. You're so funny.
answer: Why?

question: I don't know--you just are. Leaving a light for Plato. That was nice.
answer: Maybe he's scared of the dark.

question: Are you?
answer: Here we are-- out of cigarettes-- Junior's in the nurs'ry-- See how late it gets--

question: You don't need to do that.
answer: There's something I should tell you, Judy.

question: I know already. We don't have to pretend now.
answer: What a relief!

question: Is this what it's like to love somebody?
answer: You disappointed?

question: Funny Jimmy. You're so clean and you--this is silly.
answer: What?

question: You smell like baby powder.
answer: So do you.

question: I never felt so clean before.
answer: It's not going to be lonely, Judy. Not for you and not for me.

question: I love somebody. All the time I've been looking for someone to love me and now--I love somebody. And it's so easy. Why is it easy now?
answer: It is for me too.

question: I love you, Jim. I really mean it.
answer: I mean it too.

question: Save me! What you run out on me for! What you leave me alone for?
answer: Plato!

question: I don't want you for my father!
answer: Your father! You crazy nut! You crazy, crazy nut!

question: Plato! Plato!
answer: Did he hit you?

question: No!
answer: We have to go back!

question: No! I got to find him.
answer: After he tried to shoot you?

question: He didn't mean it--we shouldn't have left him. He needed us.
answer: He needed you, maybe. So do I.

question: He needs you too. Come on.
answer: You should have heard him talk about you tonight. Like you were the hero in the China Seas.

question: Sure. He was trying to make us his family.
answer: They're killing him!

question: Come out of there. You're making it tough on yourself, kid. Come out quietly now. You didn't kill anybody yet. Need a little help here!
answer: We heard firing. He get anybody? You alone?

question: We got a cookaboo inside. He wounded some kid earlier.
answer: How'd he get in?

question: Smashed the front door.
answer: Any other entrance?

question: Down in back.
answer: Silence. Please maintain silence. Keep back and stay off the pavements. Keep back and stay off the pavements. There will be emergency vehicles coming through. This warning is for your own protection.

question: Plato? Plato? Plato, you in there? Hey, I'm going to open the door now. You'll be able to see me and you can shoot me if you want, but just remember one thing, Plato--You're my friend. That means a lot to me. Plato?
answer: I'm here.

question: Boy, I'm blind as a bat! You got a match? I'm going to break my neck in here. Where are you?
answer: I've got a gun.

question: I know. Light a match, will you? That's swell. How are you?
answer: I'm fine. You think the end of the world will come at nighttime, Jim?

question: No. At dawn.
answer: Why?

question: I just have a feeling. Where are you?
answer: Here.

question: Well, stop hiding and stand up. I can't talk to you if I don't see you. Hey, look at the stars, Plato. Stand up and look at the stars. That's fine. I'm not going to hurt you.
answer: Why did you run out on me?

question: We didn't run out. We were coming right back.
answer: You sure?

question: Sure I'm sure. Judy's waiting. You ready to come out now?
answer: No.

question: I promise nothing'll happen if you do. You want my jacket? It's warm.
answer: Can I keep it?

question: What do you think? You want to give me your gun now, Plato?
answer: My gun?

question: In your pocket. Give it to me.
answer: I need it.

question: You trust me, don't you? Just give it to me for a second.
answer: You promised to give it back.

question: Friends never break promises, do they? Okay. Here. Now listen. There are a lot of people outside and they all want you to be safe. You understand that? They said I could come in and bring you out.
answer: Why?

question: They like you. Okay?
answer: Come on!

question: Hi. Who's that?
answer: Just a guard.

question: I shot at one of them.
answer: But you didn't hurt anybody.

question: Those aren't my friends. Make them go away.
answer: Ray! Will you tell these guys to move back? Plato! Don't be a fool!
